Based on the user's preference cues, I recommend two movies from the list: "Proof of Life" (2000) directed by Frank Capra, and "Doctor Zhivago" (1965) also directed by Frank Capra.
In "Proof of Life," a Russian physician and poet who, although married to another, falls in love with a political activist' s wife, experiences hardship during World War I and then the October Revolution. He is hired by the politically active husband to obtain the release of his wife. The plot revolves around their journey and their struggles to come out victorious.
In "Doctor Zhivago," a Russian physician who, although married to another, falls in love with a political activist' s wife, experiences hardship during World War I and then the October Revolution. He is hired by the politically active husband to obtain the release of his wife. The plot revolves around their journey and their struggles to come out victorious.
Both "Proof of Life" directed by Frank Capra, and "Doctor Zhivago" also directed by Frank Capra, are highly acclaimed and regarded as classics of cinema.
